Module edu.wgu.qam2schedulingapp
Package edu.wgu.qam2schedulingapp.controller

Class AppointmentController

java.lang.Object
edu.wgu.qam2schedulingapp.controller.AppointmentController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AppointmentController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller for managing appointments.

This class is responsible for handling user actions related to appointments, such as navigating to the appointment editor, adding, modifying, and deleting appointments.

Author:
Parham Modirniya

    • AppointmentController

      public AppointmentController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the controller.

      This method is called when the controller is first created. It initializes the appointment table and sets up the cell factories for the table's columns.

      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - the location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known
      resourceBundle - the resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized

    • navigateToHome

      public void navigateToHome()
      Navigates to the home page.

      This method closes the current stage and effectively navigates the user back to the home page.

    • addAppointment

      public void addAppointment()
      Opens the appointment editor to create a new appointment.

      This method is intended to be called when the user wishes to add a new appointment. It uses the navigateToEditor method with null as an argument, which signifies the creation of a new appointment.

    • modifyAppointment

      public void modifyAppointment()
      Modifies the selected appointment.

      This method retrieves the selected appointment from the table view and opens the appointment editor for modification. If no appointment is selected, it displays an error message to the user.

    • deleteAppointment

      public void deleteAppointment()
      This method handles the deletion confirmation and the result of user's decision. It uses lambda expressions to handle different user responses and perform actions accordingly.

      The first lambda expression is used as a Predicate to check if the user response is ButtonType.OK.

      The second lambda is used as a Consumer that performs an action (removing an appointment and showing an alert) when the user confirms the deletion.

      The third lambda is used as a Runnable that updates a label text when the user aborts the deletion.

      This way of using lambda expressions improves readability and simplifies the code by reducing the need for verbose anonymous class implementations.

    • showCurrentWeek

      public void showCurrentWeek()
      Filters the appointment list to show only the current week's appointments.

      This method uses the AppointmentRepository's filterWeekly() method to apply a filter on the appointment list, so that only the appointments of the current week are displayed in the table view.

    • showCurrentMonth

      public void showCurrentMonth()
      Filters the appointment list to show only the current month's appointments.

      This method uses the AppointmentRepository's filterMonthly() method to apply a filter on the appointment list, so that only the appointments of the current month are displayed in the table view.

    • showAllAppointments

      public void showAllAppointments()
      Displays all appointments without any filter.

      This method uses the AppointmentRepository's removeFilter() method to remove any existing filter on the appointment list, so that all appointments are displayed in the table view.
